org.macquarie.philosophy.animated
Class PhilosopherAnimation

java.lang.Object
  org.macquarie.philosophy.animated.PhilosopherAnimation
All Implemented Interfaces:
Animatable
public class PhilosopherAnimation
extends java.lang.Object
implements Animatable

This class keeps track of an animation which demonstrates the dining philosophers.

Author:
Dominic Verity

Field Summary
private static int CANVAS_SIZE
          The width / height of the square box in which the animated image is confined, in pixels.
private  Philosopher[] mDiners
          Contains references to all of the dining philosopher objects of our simulation.
private  java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock[] mSticks
          Contains references to all of the chopstick objects of our simulation.
private static int PARTY_SIZE
          The number of philosophers attending our party.
private static int SEATING_RADIUS
          The radius from the centre of the table at which the diners are seated.
private static int STICK_DIAMETER
          Diameter of the circle used to represent chopsticks in the animation.
private static double STICK_SEPARATION
          Angle separating chopsticks held in a philosopher's hand and the philosopher himself.
private static int TABLE_RADIUS
          The radius of our dining table.
 
Constructor Summary
PhilosopherAnimation()
          Default constructor, creates a random number generator and calls restart() to randomly initialise the position and movement of the image.
 
Method Summary
 int getHeight()
          Get the height of this animation.
 int getWidth()
          Get the width of this animation.
 void paint(java.awt.Graphics pGraphics)
          Paint the current state of the dinner party.
 void restart()
          Restart the philosophers, by sending the interrupt signal to each philosopher thread.
 void step()
          Step the animation state forward by one frame.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

mSticks

private java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock[] mSticks
Contains references to all of the chopstick objects of our simulation. Chopsticks are simply represented as reentrant lock objects.

Constructor Detail

PhilosopherAnimation

PhilosopherAnimation()
Default constructor, creates a random number generator and calls restart() to randomly initialise the position and movement of the image.
